On a bright, sunny morning, R1-D4, a shiny new robot, rolled into Sunnydale Elementary. With gears whirring and sensors buzzing, it was eager to learn. The children gawked, some excited, others a bit scared. In the first class, Math, R1-D4 calculated faster than anyone, impressing the teacher. At recess, it joined a game of tag, its agility surprising everyone. But when it accidentally knocked over a lunch tray, chaos ensued. Instead of retreating, R1-D4 helped clean up, earning smiles and laughter. By the end of the day, R1-D4 realized that school was not just about learning; it was about friendship too.
